Or your phone battery will die while you are calling. Sometimes both happen.

In the 1950s, banana farmers in Central America had a big problem. Their most popular banana, called Gros Michel or Big Mike, was dying. Now, the same problem is happening to Big Mike's replacement, the Cavendish banana. Gros Michel bananas were easy to transport, had thick skin, and tasted sweet. They were grown a lot in Central America. The main company, United Fruit, grew and sold many bananas in South America. They grew bananas by cloning shoots from plant stems, not from seeds, and planted them very close together to produce more.

Most spiders have venom. They use it to stun or kill their prey, not to attack people. Only 25 spider species have venom that can harm humans. Spider bites can hurt, but they are rarely deadly. The Sydney funnel-web spider in Australia has not caused any deaths since 1981 because of an anti-venom. Be careful with hairy spiders like tarantulas. If they feel scared, they shoot out tiny hairs. These hairs can stick in your skin or eyes and cause irritation.

This horror movie idea was very common in horror films from the late 1900s. It begins with a group of teenagers having fun. At the end, everyone is dead except one girl. At first, the girl is usually innocent, shy, and not very strong. By the end, she becomes the strongest and smartest person. The last girl almost always wins.

To understand where our ability to use complex language comes from, we must study how our brains differ from those of other animals. It is not just about brain size; it also matters what our brains can do and when and why they changed. There are very few physical signs to help us. Objects left by our ancestors do not show what kind of speech they could make. But we can see changes in the mouth, throat, and tongue of early humans. Around 100,000 years ago, humans developed the ability to make complex sounds. Before that time, scientists can only guess if early humans used simple sounds to communicate.

Society, not nature, tells us that girls should like arts and humanities, and boys should do maths and physics. Also, girls do not see many women working in science jobs. Cartoons and stories often show scientists, inventors, or astronauts as men. Some people think scientists are strange, bad at talking to others, or work alone and away from the world. These ideas are wrong and come from the media. Because of this, girls may not feel connected to scientists or want to work in science. If girls saw more women scientists as good examples, they would feel more confident and want to study science more.

The Scallion is a weekly newspaper. It is free and given out in university buildings. About 10,000 students read it. Students write and make the newspaper. A survey says students and staff like the newspaper for fun, culture, and work experience. Printing the newspaper costs a lot. Also, some students find it hard to get a copy because they must go to the university to get one. Another problem is that many copies are thrown away as litter on campus.

At Girox Foods, about 12% of employees leave each year. This number is higher than the usual 7% in the industry. This report aims to find out why employees feel involved in the company. It will also suggest ways to make work better for employees and help keep them longer.

The speaker said many true things. I believe that the more we connect online, the more alone we can feel. This is not a big problem for my generation because we lived without technology for a long time. We know how to be alone and that it is okay. But young people under 20 are different. They talk a lot online and do not often feel being alone. They might not learn to enjoy being by themselves. Also, they learn to talk by sending messages that can be changed. This can stop them from learning how to have real conversations face to face with others.

Do not always give negative feedback right after positive feedback. If positive and negative feedback always come together, people may stop valuing the positive comments. Make sure to give positive feedback sometimes without adding criticism.
